edu.iu.dsc.tws.api.comms.packing

Interface DataPacker<D,W>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - data type
    W - wrapper to hold partially read data
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PrimitiveArrayPacker<A>, PrimitivePacker<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteArrayPacker, BytePacker, CharArrayPacker, CharPacker, DoubleArrayPacker, DoublePacker, EmptyPacker, FloatArrayPacker, FloatPacker, IntegerArrayPacker, IntegerPacker, LongArrayPacker, LongPacker, ObjectPacker, ShortArrayPacker, ShortPacker, StringPacker

    public interface DataPacker<D,W>
    The data packer interface. An implementation class should be stateless.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int determineLength(D data, PackerStore store)
      Pack the data and return the size of the data in bytes once packed.
      boolean isHeaderRequired()
      Indicates whether length should be packed before the actual key
      byte[] packToByteArray(D data) 
      java.nio.ByteBuffer packToByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer, D data)
      This method puts a value to the ByteBuffer.
      java.nio.ByteBuffer packToByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer, int offset, D data)
      This method puts a value to the ByteBuffer, starting from specified index of the buffer.
      int readDataFromBuffer(ObjectBuilder<D,W> objectBuilder, int currentBufferLocation, DataBuffer dataBuffer)
      Read the buffer and build the actual object.
      D unpackFromBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer, int byteLength)
      This method will extract a value from buffer starting from buffer's current position.
      D unpackFromBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer, int bufferOffset, int byteLength)
      This method will extract a value from buffer starting from the position specified.
      default D unpackFromByteArray(byte[] array) 
      W wrapperForByteLength(int byteLength)
      Returns an empty wrapper to hold byteLength amount of type T
      void writeDataToBuffer(D data, PackerStore packerStore, int alreadyCopied, int leftToCopy, int spaceLeft, java.nio.ByteBuffer targetBuffer)
      Transfer the data to the buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • determineLength

        int determineLength(D data,
                    PackerStore store)
        Pack the data and return the size of the data in bytes once packed. However, packing(converting to byte[]) and saving to store inside this method is optional. If your have primitives that can be efficiently copied to the buffers later in writeDataToBuffer(D, edu.iu.dsc.tws.api.comms.packing.PackerStore, int, int, int, java.nio.ByteBuffer), you may just return the byte size of data from this method.
        Parameters:
        data - the data (can be Integer, Object etc)
        store - A store to temporary store the serialized data, if you had to serialize data to determine length.
        Returns:
        the size of the packed data in bytes

      • writeDataToBuffer

        void writeDataToBuffer(D data,
                       PackerStore packerStore,
                       int alreadyCopied,
                       int leftToCopy,
                       int spaceLeft,
                       java.nio.ByteBuffer targetBuffer)
        Transfer the data to the buffer. If you have already packed data to state * with determineLength(Object, PackerStore), you may transfer data from state * to targetBuffer. If not, you may directly transfer data to the targetBuffer.

      • readDataFromBuffer

        int readDataFromBuffer(ObjectBuilder<D,W> objectBuilder,
                       int currentBufferLocation,
                       DataBuffer dataBuffer)
        Read the buffer and build the actual object. This method will be called multiple times per object until this method explicitly call ObjectBuilder.setFinalObject(Object) to set and mark the end of the current object

      • packToByteArray

        byte[] packToByteArray(D data)

      • packToByteBuffer

        java.nio.ByteBuffer packToByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                                     D data)
        This method puts a value to the ByteBuffer. The position of byteBuffer should be updated.

      • packToByteBuffer

        java.nio.ByteBuffer packToByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                                     int offset,
                                     D data)
        This method puts a value to the ByteBuffer, starting from specified index of the buffer. The position of the buffer shouldn't be affected

      • wrapperForByteLength

        W wrapperForByteLength(int byteLength)
        Returns an empty wrapper to hold byteLength amount of type T

      • isHeaderRequired

        boolean isHeaderRequired()
        Indicates whether length should be packed before the actual key

      • unpackFromBuffer

        D unpackFromBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                   int bufferOffset,
                   int byteLength)
        This method will extract a value from buffer starting from the position specified. Buffer position shouldn't be affected by this method
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - ByteBuffer instance
        bufferOffset - position to start reading from buffer
        byteLength - amount of data to read

      • unpackFromBuffer

        D unpackFromBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                   int byteLength)
        This method will extract a value from buffer starting from buffer's current position. Buffer position should be updated.

      • unpackFromByteArray

        default D unpackFromByteArray(byte[] array)
